Morris Museum of Art • 1 Tenth Street • Augusta, Georgia 30901

MORRIS MUSEUM OF ART

SOUTHERN COLLECTION

Below are the artworks in the Southern Collection of the Morris Museum of Art. Use Control+F to search this page.

Return to the Morris Museum's Library Collection page.

Return to the Morris Museum's Permanent Collection page.

Artist: Emma Amos
Title: Does Black Rub Off?
Date: 1999
Medium: Oil on canvas, African fabric, and photo transfers
Measurements: overall: 90 x 56"
Credit Line: Gift of the American Academy of Arts and Letters, New York; Hassam, Speicher, Betts and Symons Funds, 2003
Description: Blond woman in black dress with a black face standing against a blue background. Orange and white fabric with a hand print design frames the canvas. Each corner has a glove stitched onto it.
Accession No.: 2003.088

Artist: Leon Applebaum
Title: Freeform Bowl
Date: Circa 1998
Medium: Blown glass
Measurements: 8 x 21 x 9"
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: From Lava Series, the vessel of elongated horizontal form with a clear glass body and fused multi-color shards, providing a rainbow-like appearance.
Accession No.: 2019.14.133

Artist: Leon Applebaum
Title: Three Part Geode
Date: Circa 1995
Medium: Blown, cut, and polished glass
Measurements: 7 x 11 x 9 inches
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: Series of three semicircle components, each with a rainbow-like interior having bands of purple, blue, orange, pink, and one exterior edge with a rought stone-like texture all fused together.
Accession No.: 2019.14.015

Artist: Leo Doyle
Title: Untitled
Date: Undated
Medium: Polychromed wood with acrylic paint
Measurements: overall: 16½ x 5 x 8"
Credit line: Gift of Julia J. Norrell
Description: This is one of a series of sculptures inspried by the Quilts of Gees Bends, which were sold at the Virginia Breier Gallery in San Francisco. The recycled ply chromed construction wood base and carved Jelutong bird are painted with acrylics. Leo Doyle's simple and classic bird shape finds a place on many of his pieces.

Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: Light-blue rectangular vessel with a concave oval-form interior, raised on a cross-shaped support in hues of blue and green, all resting on a square black base with slanted sides. Element A is the upper section of the light blue and clear horizontal rectangular form, element B is the lower half, of darker blue and green vertical rectangular shape.
Accession No.: 2019.14.053b

Medium: Oil on canvas
Measurements: image: 12 x 18"
Description: Frontal view of large white plantation house with green shutters across open grassy yard with dirt road running diagonally across it; open gate in foreground between vine-covered decaying brick wall; several small figures roam perimeter of house and gardens.

Description: Sculpture compromised of a series of stacked triangular pieces of blue grass framed in rusted-color steel, resting on a plinth base.
Accession No.: 2019.14.062

Artist: Brent Kee Young
Title: Bones (Fossil Series)
Date: 1982
Medium: Blown glass with negative relief images, multilayered copper glass and clear overlays, and flame-worked inclusions
Measurements: 8¼ x 6"
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: From the Fossil Series, ovoid form vase with internal decoration resembling fossilized impressions of fish specimens in the earth, encased in a clear heavy glass. Blown and cased glass with lampworked inclusions.
Accession No.: 2019.14.099

Artist: Brent Kee Young
Title: Seascape, June (Fossil Series)
Date: circa 1995
Medium: Cast glass and American Slate
Measurements: 27 x 12 x 22½"
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: From the Fossil series, the pink colored tapered form with imprints of fossil specimens, raied on a stepped red stone base.
Accession No.: 2019.14.091

Artist: Brent Kee Young
Title: Snake River Shelter (Matrix Series)
Date: 2014
Medium: Flame-worked borosilicate glass
Measurements: 32 x 21 x 27"
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: From the Matric Series, the sculpture comprised of clear glass squiggle components linked together to depict a shelter penetrated by a tree trunk.
Accession No.: 2019.14.109

Artist: Bruno Zupan

Date: 2001
Medium: Oil on canvas

Artist: Toots Zynsky
Title: Calare
Date: 2014
Medium: Fillet-de-verre
Measurements: 7½ x 24¼ x 10"
Credit line: Gift of Eugene Fleischer
Description: Undulating basket form comprised of thousands of glass threads in subtle graduations of red.
Accession No.: 2019.14.161
